nodes.text: A Clone Captain was a clone trooper officer who served in the Grand Army of the Republic during the pan-galactic Clone Wars between the Galactic Republic and the Separatist Alliance. During his service, he was active with the military rank of Clone Captain and was part of the 41st Elite Corps's Green Company, which was stationed aboard the Venator-class Star Destroyer flagship Tranquility early during the war in 22 BBY.

After the capture of Viceroy of the Trade Federation Nute Gunray, a skirmish took place aboard the Tranquility as Separatist forces attempted to capture the Viceroy or silence him. The Clone Captain partook in the skirmish by locking down the starship's engine room alongside another clone trooper, and failed to detect the Separatist agent Asajj Ventress inside. After the captain checked in with Clone Commander CC-1004 "Gree," he and the trooper moved to the prison level, allowing Ventress to sabotage the reactor of the vessel and disorienting the crew. The skirmish ultimately culminated in the successful Separatist rescue of Gunray.

Created on the planet Kamino from the DNA of Jango Fett, a bounty hunter who was the template of the clone trooper army, the clone was a clone trooper officer within the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars between the Galactic Republic and the Separatist Alliance.

By 22 BBY, the clone served as a clone trooper officer within the 41st Elite Corps' Green Company with the military rank of Clone Captain, and was stationed aboard the Republic Venator-class Star Destroyer Tranquility. At this time, Viceroy of the Trade Federation and Separatist Council member Nute Gunray was captured on the planet Rodia by Senator Padmé Amidala and her companions. The 41st Elite Corps' Green Company was dispatched to retrieve the Viceroy and transport him to the Tranquility so that he could be detained and interrogated in Coruscant and expose Separatist information.

After Gunray was taken into custody by Senate Commandos led by Captain Faro Argyus, Gunray was interrogated in the flagship Tranquility's prison level by Jedi General Luminara Unduli and Jedi Commander Ahsoka Tano when they were attacked by Separatist vulture droid starfighters and Droch-class boarding ships. Clone Commander CC-1004 "Gree," commanding officer of the 41st Elite Corps, deployed Green Company to repel Separatist forces. During the attack, the captain and another clone trooper checked the reactor room for any signs of Separatist forces, failing to detect Separatist agent Asajj Ventress who had infiltrated the ship and set up explosives. They did, however, encounter the WED-15 Treadwell droid 327-T, who was inspecting the reactor room before they arrived. The captain contacted Commander Gree to inform him that the reactor room was secured, and was responded by Gree ordering the captain to move to the prison level, where remaining Separatist forces were located, an order which the captain acknowledged.

The accompanying clone trooper then ordered 327-T to watch for intruders but when 327-T protested about how it was addressed, the captain told the trooper that droids did not like being called by their nicknames. With Ventress avoiding detection, she was able to sabotage the reactor and cripple the Tranquility, along with disorienting Republic forces. By the end of the skirmish, Ventress managed to successfully rescue Gunray from the grip of the Republic.

As a clone of the bounty hunter Jango Fett, the captain was a human male who stood at 1.83 meters tall, had tan skin, and brown eyes. The Clone Captain was knowledgeable that droids did not like being called by their nicknames. The captain was also comfortable reporting that the reactor room appeared cleared without conducting a lockdown of the area as he reported in.
The clone was trained in combat like all fellow clone troopers, excelling to reach the rank of captain.

Despite being an officer, the Clone Captain did not personalize their standard phase I clone trooper armor or upgrade it with any additional equipment. As part of Green Company, the captain had the same standard green markings on his white clone trooper armor. He utilized a DC-15A blaster carbine.
The clone first appeared, albeit unnamed, in the ninth episode of the first season of Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series, "Cloak of Darkness," which aired on December 5, 2008.
